questionListItems.title: What is the eligibility criteria to offer Higher Mother Tongue Language (HMTL)?

answer.body:
(i) Students with an overall PSLE Score of 8 or better and offered MTL at PSLE

OR (ii) students with an overall PSLE Score of 9-14 (inclusive) and obtained AL1/AL2 in MTL or Distinction/Merit in HMTL.

questionListItems.title: Does the school organise any overseas trip for students?

answer.body: We do have internationalisation programmes organised for our students every year, mainly catered for the Secondary 2 and Secondary 3 students. We have organised cultural immersion and youth leaderships training trips to places like Taiwan, Vietnam, China and Thailand.

questionListItems.title: Are students expected to purchase a laptop for learning?

answer.body: On 28 June 2020, MOE announced that every secondary school student will be equipped with a personal learning device by the end of 2021 in an effort to raise the country's digital literacy. All students in the school will be using devices of the same model and the purchasing of the devices will be done in school. Secondary 1 parents will be briefed on this at a later date in term 1.

questionListItems.title: What payment methods are available to purchase the PLD?

answer.body: Students who are Singapore citizens can use their Edusave to pay fully or partly for the PLD, after setting aside provision for payment of miscellaneous fees. Parents/Guardians can also choose to pay cash for the PLD.

questionListItems.title: What are the software applications available for my child?

answer.body:
Schools will progressively roll out IT applications that will be vital for students’ teaching and learning. These include:

  • Student iCON: Every secondary school student will be provided with access to the Google Suite set of tools, including email address.

  • Microsoft Office 365: Every secondary school student will be able to use Microsoft Office tools that include Word, PowerPoint and Excel.

  • Zoom: Every secondary school student will be given a free Zoom account with a 40-minute time limit for their video conferencing needs.


The school will need to use your child’s/ward’s full name, Student iCON ID and class to set up user accounts. Schools may also choose to roll out applications other than those listed above.

questionListItems.title: My child already owns a learning device. Do I still have to opt-in purchase of the PLD?

answer.body:
We strongly encourage parents to purchase the school’s PLD as we would like to ensure that your child is able to enjoy the same learning experience and platform as their classmates, including benefiting from the 3-year warranty and 3-year insurance covered during their education years in BBSS.

 

If your child prefers to use their personal device (i.e. not Chromebook), kindly note the following:

  • Incompatibility issues may occur when installing software and applications;

  • Parents may have to resort to visiting external shops for repairs if the device faces software/hardware issues, as there is no warranty and insurance coverage under the school;

  • Due to the nature of the DMA, the school can only support Chrome OS devices (Chromebooks).

  • Important: Do not install Chromium OS or Chrome OS on a Windows or Android device. It is not considered a “Chromebook”.


If your child’s personal device is a Chromebook, the school will then ascertain whether:

  • The technical specifications and features of his/her personal device are on par with (or better than) the school-prescribed Chromebook, and

  • It meets the minimum requirement and OS version to support the Device Management Application (DMA), with reference to MOE’s guidelines.


Upon completing and passing the assessment, the school will then assist in installing the DMA on your child’s personal device (uninstalled upon graduation).

questionListItems.title: Why did the school choose a Chromebook as their choice of PLD?

answer.body: After much comparison and consideration, the school evaluated that the Chromebook serves the teaching and learning environment. Favourable factors include its lightweight, long battery life, military-grade durability and stable operating system. It also has a built-in HD camera, convertible functionality, a full touchscreen and a stylus pen for digital inking.

questionListItems.title: If I do not qualify for HMTL by the MOE criteria, can I appeal for HMTL?

answer.body:
Yes you can. Our school will assess the eligibility based on the MTL and the overall results. The criteria will vary from cohort to cohort and this criteria will be made known after the posting results are out. 


Parents may then submit their appeal application form and wait for the appeal outcome. 


If you are unsuccessful in your outcome, students who do well at the end of Secondary 1 will still be offered the opportunity to do HMTL, subject to the subject teacher’s recommendation.
